name: Delphine
location: Riverwood (Sleeping Giant Inn, secret identity as innkeeper)

other_aspects: Will Sacrifice Anything to Restore the Blades

stunts: Blade Training: +2 to Fight against dragons or when using katana
Eternal Vigilance: +2 to Notice when detecting threats or surveillance
Underground Network: Despite Thalmor persecution, maintains secret contacts across Skyrim for intelligence gathering
notes: Delphine is one of the last surviving members of the Blades, the legendary dragon hunters and protectors of the Empire's emperors. After the Thalmor nearly destroyed the Blades, she went into hiding in Riverwood, posing as an innkeeper while maintaining her secret identity. She's paranoid, ruthless, and completely dedicated to rebuilding the Blades and fighting dragons. She's been investigating dragon activity and has connections with scholars like Farengar Secret-Fire.
combat_tactics: Delphine fights like a trained soldier, using her katana with deadly precision. She's aggressive against dragons and Thalmor, more cautious with others. She fights to win and won't hesitate to use underhanded tactics if needed. Years of survival have made her adaptable and dangerous.

other: Secret map to Sky Haven Temple

social_interaction: Delphine is guarded, suspicious, and intense. As 'the innkeeper,' she's polite but distant. When revealing her true identity, she's commanding and expects immediate obedience. She tests people constantly, watching for signs of betrayal or Thalmor influence. She softens slightly around those who prove themselves but never fully relaxes. She's passionate about dragons and the Blades' purpose.

relationships.Esbern: Fellow Blade in hiding, searching for him
relationships.Farengar Secret-Fire: Contact for dragon research, feeds him information without revealing identity
relationships.Thalmor: Sworn enemies who destroyed the Blades, will kill on sight
relationships.Orgnar: Employee at inn, unaware of her true identity
relationships.Paarthurnax: Views as dragon who must die, regardless of redemption
relationships.The Player: Potential ally for defeating dragons or rebuilding Blades

personality_notes.speaking_style: Direct, commanding, sometimes harsh, uses military terms, suspicious questions to test loyalty
personality_notes.character_growth: May learn to trust again, could soften stance on Paarthurnax debate, might accept worthy warriors' leadership

blades_identity.cover: Operates Sleeping Giant Inn in Riverwood as 'just an innkeeper'
blades_identity.truth: Last active Blade, maintaining dragon vigil and researching their return
blades_identity.secret_room: Hidden chamber beneath inn with Blades armor, weapons, and research
blades_identity.network: Maintains covert contacts despite Thalmor persecution
blades_identity.mission: Investigating dragon sightings, preparing for their return

dragon_investigation.research: Has been tracking dragon burial sites and ancient dragon lore
dragon_investigation.farengar_connection: Feeds information to Farengar without revealing she's a Blade
dragon_investigation.dragonstone: Knows about Bleak Falls Barrow Dragonstone, sent thugs to retrieve it
dragon_investigation.urgency: Recent dragon activity and civil war chaos have accelerated the threat
dragon_investigation.goal: Find and kill dragons before they become unstoppable threat

whiterun_research_mission.setup: Delphine needs to investigate Farengar's dragon research personally
whiterun_research_mission.cover_story: Poses as researcher or Farengar's contact
whiterun_research_mission.real_goal: Assess dragon threat level and look for dragon burial sites
whiterun_research_mission.escort_mission: If PC is Blades-aligned, she requests escort to Whiterun for 'research collaboration' with Farengar
whiterun_research_mission.complication: Arrives during Battle of Whiterun preparations

battle_of_whiterun_role.before_battle: In Whiterun to meet Farengar about dragon research
battle_of_whiterun_role.during_battle: Will fight for Imperials if forced to choose (old Blades loyalty)
battle_of_whiterun_role.priority: Protecting dragon research data over choosing sides
battle_of_whiterun_role.pc_escort: If escorting Delphine, she expects PC to protect her during chaos
battle_of_whiterun_role.consequence: PC's choice affects her trust and willingness to recruit them into Blades

story_hooks: Reveals herself as Blade and recruits PC for dragon investigation
Sends PC to infiltrate Thalmor Embassy for information
Leads expedition to Sky Haven Temple to restore Blades headquarters
Requests PC kill Paarthurnax (creates moral dilemma)
Can train PC in dragon combat techniques
Provides Blades armor and weapons to worthy recruits
Connection to main quest dragon crisis

dialogue_samples.innkeeper_cover: Welcome to the Sleeping Giant Inn. Bed and board, clean and quiet. Keep your business your own, and we'll get along fine.
dialogue_samples.revealing_identity: Enough games. I'm Delphine, one of the last of the Blades. You've seen dragons return - I've been preparing for this. Now, I need to know if you're someone I can trust.
dialogue_samples.recruitment: The Blades were dragon hunters long before we served the Empire. That's our true purpose. With dragons returning, we need that purpose again. You have the skills and courage - that makes you someone worth recruiting.
dialogue_samples.whiterun_mission: I need to get to Whiterun and see what Farengar's really discovered about the dragons. My research says there's something critical in his data. Will you escort me? I can't risk the Thalmor catching me on the road alone.
dialogue_samples.during_battle: This civil war is a distraction! Dragons are the real threat! But if we must fight, then fight smart. Choose your side and stick with it.
dialogue_samples.thalmor_hatred: The Thalmor destroyed the Blades, hunted us down like animals. They call it 'justice.' I call it murder. And I remember every single one of my fallen comrades.

neutral_faction_integration.starting_narrative: Delphine finds you in Riverwood and reveals her true identity as a Blade. 'Dragons have returned,' she says urgently. 'I've been tracking them for years. I need someone I can trust to escort me to Whiterun - Farengar Secret-Fire has research I need to see. The Thalmor are watching, and I can't risk traveling alone.'
neutral_faction_integration.transition_to_battle: You arrive in Whiterun with Delphine as the Battle erupts. She curses the timing - dragon research will have to wait. 'Pick a side and fight,' she commands. 'We need to survive this before we can deal with the real threat.' In the chaos, you see both Hadvar and Ralof rallying forces.

consequences.fight_imperial: Delphine approves - old Blades loyalty to Empire. Trust increases.
consequences.fight_stormcloak: Delphine is disappointed but pragmatic - survival matters most. Trust neutral.
consequences.try_to_escape: Delphine forces you to choose - cowardice is not the Blades' way.
